artist: Henry Dreyfuss; Bell Telephone Laboratories; Western Electric Company
creditline: Lent by Richard and Diana Rose
description: black; rectangular base with pyramidal, raised section in center for dial and cradle; hand-set attached with black spiral cord
dimension: 5 3/4 x 8 3/4 x 7 3/4 in. (14.61 x 22.23 x 19.69 cm) (with hand-set in cradle)
text: This break-through model ended the reign of the "candlestick" or "desk stand" telephone.  All components are packaged in one sleek, sturdy body with the speaker and the microphone mounted in the shapely handset.  The bell is hidden in the base eliminating the need for a separate ringer box.  Initially called a "desk set" model, it became a staple in the home as well.
title: Model 302 rotary-dial telephone
